case_title: NOOR MUHAMMAD vs MUHAMMAD ASHRAF And 7 OTHER

summary.previous_case_reference: R.O.R. No.1277/1987 (Muhammad Ashraf etc. v. State etc.)
summary.key_decision: Muhammad Ashraf etc., heirs of Hafiz Muhammad Khan, had no right to purchase Lambardari grant in Chak No.48/DNB. Noor Muhammad also could not be allotted the grant due to suspension of allotment scheme.
summary.temporary_arrangement: Muhammad Ashraf etc. allowed temporary lease on year-to-year basis with market rent, subject to surrendering possession if required for public purposes.
summary.applicant_objection: Noor Muhammad contested that Muhammad Ashraf etc. were not in occupation of the land and had been unfairly allowed lease despite owning other land.
summary.clarification: Muhammad Ashraf etc. are neither regular lessees nor have rights under temporary cultivation schemes. Their occupation is temporary and subject to government policy changes.

disposition.clarification: If Muhammad Ashraf etc. are no longer in possession, the impugned order does not apply. If they are in possession, they must pay market rent and surrender possession upon government directive.
